text:
Hhmm… how did I miss a whole year?
```julia> Dates.epochms2datetime(0)
0000-01-01T00:00:00

julia> DateTime(0,1,1).instant
Dates.UTInstant{Millisecond}(Millisecond(-31536000000))```

elements.text: Hhmm… how did I miss a whole year?

text: It looks like "zero-time" is set to december 31st, 1 BCE. That's a little weird, but it does cimplify calculating the instant from a given date.

elements.text: It looks like "zero-time" is set to december 31st, 1 BCE. That's a little weird, but it does cimplify calculating the instant from a given date.

text: The discrepancy ultimately comes from the fact that the georgian calendar is one-indexed (i.e. the first year is year 1), and the year before year 1 was year 1 BC, whereas UT time needs to be continuous, so year 0000 in UT corresponds to 1 BC

elements.text: The discrepancy ultimately comes from the fact that the georgian calendar is one-indexed (i.e. the first year is year 1), and the year before year 1 was year 1 BC, whereas UT time needs to be continuous, so year 0000 in UT corresponds to 1 BC
